raw_comment: I noticed that in basketball and football the majority of players are people of color with around 80% being people of color. In soccer around 60% are people of color and in baseball only about 40% are people of color. I also noticed that the majority of head coaches are not people of color. I wonder why football, basketball, and soccer have a majority of players being people of color but not baseball. Our community is impacted because it shows that people of color have an equal opportunity to be a player in some sports. It also impacts our community by showing that people of color have a lower chance to be in positions of power as shown in statistics for head coaches. I would title the graph "How Diverse are Major League Sports?"
ace_sentences: In basketball, around 80% of players are people of color.
In football, around 80% of players are people of color.

I wonder why football has a majority of players who are people of color.
I wonder why basketball has a majority of players who are people of color.
I wonder why soccer has a majority of players who are people of color.
